message: Will it be hard to crack?

data.message: nothing is absolute  , yes this will make it harder against dictionary attacks & brute forcing bu for attacks like but so does inserting a special characters [and i think there is a high possibility someone will use an Arabic dictionary/character list against you anyway if the attack is targeted ] but for something like hash cracking it depend on how common is your phrase , using something like "بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم " for example is a bad practice because for some reason this is a very common password in our communities and the hash for it is probably already calculated in every hash table designed for Arabic users  , this is all for nothing of course if the  website/service is not hashing/salting the passwords and storing it plain text
Mohamed Abdel Aty What if the hash is stronger like SHA1? Just asking out of curiosity (without googling it xD).
Most of the websites storing password in database unencrypted.

Also if the website is advanced as Facebook you may find a 2nd verification method by sms (so if you wanted to login from a new device you have to verify it by an sms text to your mobile) which makes it even harder to hack you.

again nothing is absolute  , " strong " is a relative word that can only be defined if you know what you are measuring against , if the website is storing the password in plain text then even if you used Chinese/Arabic/hieroglyphics mix password it will not protect you for a second against and server side attack like SQLI , this also apply if the website is not using SSL 

hashing power is not a factor if the password is common [without salt ] , the password would be already calculated and would be the same as plain text
not all the password are cracked xD also I guess it will be hard to login even if he have the password if there is a 2nd verification method like in here in Facebook.
